resource.name: Plats & Surveys
resource.description: All County plats and surveys recorded before 2008 are linked in this dataset.

resource.name: Presidential Election Results And Turnout 1936-2016
resource.description: This dataset shows the total turnout as well as the vote counts for the two major parties in Macoupin County from 1936 to 2016. The national winner is listed first in the Election field.

resource.name: Genealogy Birth Index
resource.description: This dataset provides an index of all birth records on file in Macoupin County before 1916. Those looking for genealogy copies of birth records can search this record by name and date of birth. They can then order a genealogy copy online using the certified copy request self service site and checking the genealogy copy option. https://selfservice.macoupincountyil.gov/web/action/ACTIONGROUP239S1

resource.name: Animal Control Monthly Board Reports
resource.description: Starting in late 2008, the Animal Control Administrator submits a report to the County Board showing data such as the number of adoptions done each month or how many calls the administrator is called out on. This dataset includes links to copies of the pdf reports the Animal Control administrator submits to the Board. The previous month's data is provided in each month's report submitted to the Board.

resource.name: Resolutions
resource.description: All resolutions adopted by the County Board are available in this dataset.

resource.name: US Alliance for Election Excellence Grant Expenditures
Macoupin Mine Maps and Documents
resource.description: All maps, permits, applications and various documents filed with the County Clerk's office from the Illinois Department of Natural Resources regarding mines in Macoupin County.

resource.name: Election Judge Tracker
resource.description:
Election judges are essential to ensuring that our elections are fair, and in doing so, maintain the traditions of our past and our hope for the future.

In an effort to continue providing voters with unprecedented levels of transparency, County Clerk Pete Duncan is providing Macoupin County voters, for the first time, a weekly update on how many judges still need to confirm that they will be able to work on Election Day. The goal would be to see each column with '0' as all positions would be filled by that point. 

The first letters asking judges to confirm that they would be able to serve went out September 8th.

resource.name: Voter Registration and Turnout
resource.description: A history of voter registration and turnout at each election from 1986 to 2018

resource.name: Midterm Election Turnout and Governor Results 1978-2018
resource.description: This dataset shows the total turnout as well as the vote counts for the two major parties in Macoupin County from 1938 to 2018. The statewide winner is listed first in the Election field.

resource.name: County Contracts
resource.description: This dataset includes links to all County Board approved contracts as well as any contracts Elected Officials or Department heads have opted to put online.

resource.name: Recorded Foreclosures - 2015
resource.description: Foreclosures recorded with the Macoupin County Recorder of Deeds. Data covers 2015. All documents recorded under the document type 'LP' are listed. Please visit http://macoupincountyil.gov/county_clerk_remote.htm for remote access to the full index of recorded documents and print copies.

resource.name: Genealogy Marriage Index
resource.description: This dataset provides an index of all marriage records on file in Macoupin County before 1916. Those looking for genealogy copies of marriage records can search this record by name and date of marriage. They can then order a genealogy copy online using the certified copy request self service site and checking the genealogy copy option. https://selfservice.macoupincountyil.gov/web/action/ACTIONGROUP239S1

resource.name: 30 Year Analysis Of Macoupin Voters Undervoting In Primary Elections
resource.description: Any Election, there is under voting in which more people vote in one particular race than another. This dataset includes over 30 years of primary elections and shows a countywide race versus a statewide or congressional race and the total number of undervotes.

resource.name: Party Ballots Pulled Per Primary
resource.description: Every two years, voters must pull either a Democratic or Republican ballot. This dataset shows the number of voters pulling each party ballot going back to 1938.

resource.name: Military Discharges
resource.description: In 2019, state law was changed to make any military discharge that had been recorded for more than 62 years available to the public. As a service to military members and their families, Macoupin County has this index of every discharge filed 62 years or longer available online. Anyone wishing to request a copy can find a request form at http://macoupincountyclerk.com/county_clerk_s_office/military_discharge_records.php. There is no charge for a copy of the record.

resource.name: Macoupin County - Payroll
resource.description: Dataset that powers:  http://payroll.macoupincountyil.gov/

resource.name: Early Voting by Day in General Elections 2008-2022
resource.description: This dataset shows by day how many votes were cast early in person in each General Election from 2008 to 2022. The numbers by show what the running total for each election. To see how many voters voted on an idividual day, subtract the previous days total to that day.

resource.name: American Rescue Plan Funding Expenses
resource.description: In March 2021, Congress passed President Biden's American Rescue Plan, which included funding to local governments. As part of the law, Macoupin County will receive $8,713,121 in funding. The money can only be spent based on the rules from the U.S. Treasury Department. As of August 1, 2021, the main objectives for the funding is 1) Support urgent COVID-19 response efforts to continue to decrease spread of the virus and bring the pandemic under control, 2) Replace lost revenue for eligible state, local, territorial, and Tribal governments to strengthen support for vital public services and help retain jobs, 3)Support immediate economic stabilization for households and businesses, and 4) Address systemic public health and economic challenges that have contributed to the inequal impact of the pandemic. This dataset will show how Macoupin County is choosing to spend the American Rescue Plan funding. You can see a short description of the expense, how much has been spent as of today on that item, and how much the county expects to spend for that item. The County has until December 2024 to budget all of their funds and until 2026 to spend it.
columns_description: This is the amount approved by the County Board for the request.
This is the amount that has been spent on the request so far.
This is a brief description of the project provided by the official or department head who made the request.

resource.name: Macoupin County Budget
resource.description: Budget for 1997-2014.

resource.name: County Ground Lease
resource.description: The County leases some of the ground it owns for farm land or other purposes. Any current lease or lease started since 2002 is linked here. A yearly lease report is presented to the Board for review of yearly payments. Please look in the spring for the yearly lease reports.

resource.name: County Board Appointments
resource.description: Numerous boards and districts have their membership approved by the County Board. This dataset includes a list of all appointments made by the County Board, which district they were appointed to as well as when their term expires.

resource.name: Polling Places
resource.description: A listing of each precinct's polling place with physical address.

resource.name: Yearly Court Case Filing Statistics
resource.description: A look at yearly number of case filings per court case types. Going back to 2006 and updated yearly.

resource.name: Lotus Wind Farm Permit Application & Public Hearing Documents
resource.description: On April 10th, 2023, Lotus Wind submitted an application for a siting permit for a wind farm. This dataset includes links to the cover letter, application, and all appendixes for public inspection. A public hearing will be held before final action is taken by the Board.

resource.name: Early, Mail and Grace Period Voting
resource.description: In 2006, Illinois started early voting before Election Day. Since then, more and more voters are voting early. This dataset includes stats of how many voters cast their ballot early, how many voted by mail, how many military voters voted, etc.

resource.name: Vendor dataset
resource.description: A listing of all vendors used by the County that are processed through the County Clerk and Treasurer offices.

resource.name: Macoupin County: Open Expenditures Ledger
resource.description: for http://checkbook.macoupincountyil.gov/

resource.name: Recorded Mortgages - 2015
resource.description: Mortgages recorded with the Macoupin County Recorder of Deeds. Data covers 2015. All documents recorded under the document type 'MTG' are listed. Please visit http://macoupincountyil.gov/county_clerk_remote.htm for remote access to the full index of recorded documents and print copies.

Those looking for genealogy copies of death records can search this record by name and date of death. They can then order a genealogy copy online using the certified copy request self service site and checking the genealogy copy option. https://selfservice.macoupincountyil.gov/web/action/ACTIONGROUP239S1

resource.description: Quit Claim Deeds recorded with the Macoupin County Recorder of Deeds. Data covers 2015. All documents recorded under the document type 'QCD' are listed.
